name: places/ChIJ3RZiK4ZYwokRkfy-k5MV57w
formattedAddress: 246 W 80th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 246 W 80th St, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text: Went on 1/6/24 for a friend's birthday. They state on their site to arrive early b/c they start promptly at 7pm. No exceptions. Information that should be expressed on the confirmation email they send the moment they take money from your account. Not only did the class begin closer to 8pm, we couldn't see his technique as he spoke/painted since we were seated on the left side of the room near the door. All we were able to see was his back as he explained what we should be doing. I even asked him if he could do the next set of steps standing on the right side of the canvas so we could at least see SOMETHING that night, but he mumbled something and stood right in the same spot blocking the canvas so we were pretty much guessing throughout the entire class. He was impatient and seemed annoyed rushing through the rest of the painting - likely because of starting so late. You're also squeezed close to people where you have to either fear you'll get paint on their clothes, or vice versa, & the brushes they provide are worn with missing bristles.  I was happy to be with my friends but this was not a positive experience. There are other businesses that offer the same paint & booze and I'd suggest giving them your money instead.

originalText.text: This was a date night event, and she loved it. I couldn't sip and paint because I left my non-alcoholic drink at home. Next time we go, I will make sure to bring my drink along. We painted for 2hrs and it feels like 30mins, because every moment is interesting. Money well spent. We will definitely visit again.

originalText.text: Awesome space and environment! The host was really nice and patient with ensuring that everyone was on pace to complete their painting! They offer many different wines and beers! Very nice selection of music and overall just a great time to spend with friends and or family!

text.text: Awesome space and environment! The host was really nice and patient with ensuring that everyone was on pace to complete their painting! They offer many different wines and beers! Very nice selection of music and overall just a great time to spend with friends and or family!

originalText.text: Experience was mediocre at best. Old school studio with a retro feel including the music. That wasn’t bad. I was more annoyed that the painting was changed last minute  and the fact that the brushes were old brushes with frayed hairs. It’s almost impossible to paint something beautiful with those tools. Please supply a standard large, medium and small brush. Note to the owner please invest in new brushes PLEASE. The instructor was sweet but that’s about it. The experience was low energy and a bit strange honestly. Really was looking forward to this experience, I’m bummed.

originalText.text:
I was excited to host my 12-14 people private party here for 12/12. I’ve been in contact with Yaffa the owner for the last few days planning this. Three days ago i was told to give in my cards information and I didn’t provide all 16 card numbers, I gave them 15. I understand my error in this case. The owner told me three days ago that my card would be placed under a hold with no money taken out of it to secure my event for 12/12. She told me that the $600 hold would be charged***THE DAY OF THE EVENT AT CHECK IN*** Just now, Yaffa took my updated card information and told me the entire amount of $600 would be charged today, 12 days before the event. The information is so conflicting, it’s so unprofessional. I was genuinely very excited to have my birthday here, I had people who were planning to travel 2+ hours to come to the city for the evening.

Additionally, there is no secure way of sending your card information to them. You send them your card info via email in a pdf file.

I’m beyond disappointed with this business and their inconsistencies.
